text: heavy one today I will make Vietnamese
krispies tumbling which is a very
popular strict snack in many parts of
Vietnam especially in Hanoi Hanoi is the
capital city of Vietnam and is located
in the north of the country with Skoda
here and therefore you can fire a lot
more deep frying food in Hanoi
especially in the old quarter or fork or
the best food is involved in fancy
restaurants but in small narrow alleys
everything happens on the street you can
fire from boiling soup pot - sizzling
frying pan on doorsteps I was in Hanoi a
few months ago and was brought to this
shop by our friend is one of the most
famous place in Hanoi that sell this
neck just set up a few stones on the
pavement and you have your customized
dining table it's not that they can't
afford better seating it's just a
lifestyle here it might take some time
to get used to this style eating but I
think it's a very interesting experience
as many other Vietnamese dishes the
crispy dumplings are served with a bowl
of dipping sauce and a platter of fresh
greens like
and herbs today I would try to duplicate
this dish at home so let's begin
recipes firstly you want to soak the
wood ear mushrooms in hot water for
about 15 minutes until softened also
soak the glass noodle in warm water for
about five minutes and chop them up
finely together with some wings shallots
or white bass Bing onion season the
means meat with some short sugar and
stock powder about a teaspoon edge also
add two tablespoons of minced spring
onion why part only and some cracked
pepper originally we use minced pork but
you can of course your chicken as well
come by the mince meat with the chopped
mushrooms and glass noodles you can add
some vegetables into the fillings to add
more texture and moisture today I use
half a cup of mix carrots but you can
also use jicama a water chestnuts or
onion mix until well combined and set
aside for about 15 minutes
hard-boiled eggs for about four minutes
then peel for the wrapper you can use
our skin 110 or swickle wrapper that I
saw frozen an Asian store it's very
convenient and can save you a lot of
time but you can also make it from
scratch using all-purpose flour baking
powder salt sugar and warm water can buy
everything in the bowl and stir to let
the flour absorb the water
you can ask a little bit of turmeric
powder to give the wrapper a nicer
yellow color then meet with your hands
or I use a food processor to form it
into a piece of dough if you knead by
hands it might take about 10 minutes the
surface of the dough might look quite
rough but that's okay just place it back
into the bowl cover with plastic wrap
and let it rest for about half an hour
after half an hour to an hour resting
knead the dough for about one more
minute and roll it flat you want the
wrapper to be acting as possible so roll
it really flat if you have a pasta
machine now is the perfect time to use
it then cut the dough into circles and
you have your homemade dumpling wrappers
not too difficult right to assemble the
dumpling place a teaspoon of the
fillings in the center and top it up
with quail egg if you use store-bought
wrapper you have to cut the quail egg in
half or quarters otherwise is going to
be too big
dip your finger in water and run around
the edges then fold the wrapper in half
and pinch the edges together to form a
Halfmoon shape for six to seven pleats
around the edge of the wrapper and press
to seal is called bun seed
there's another folding star that works
better with Hama crapper
which is the twisting star also place
the feelings in the center fold in half
and pinch the edges together then
identify the angle and fold it in and
just keep twisting in the reported edge
of the wrapper like that until you get a
dumpling that looks like a pillow that's
why it's also called one gooey or pillow
cake in some other parts of Vietnam is
also called one quite bad that's because
it looks like the handle of the bronzer
control that you normally see in front
of royal palaces in Asia to do fry the
dumplings heat two inches of vegetable
oil
when you stand a wooden chopstick into
the oil and see small bubbles appear
around it is when it's hot enough
carefully slide the dumplings from the
side of the walk into the hot oil fry on
medium heat until golden brown when the
dumplings float to the surface and turn
golden brown on both sides let them rest
on a rack or paper towel to drain off
the excess oil
prepare for bleeping fish sauce some
lettuce and fresh herbs like mint or
coriander to get the recipe for the
dipping sauce just click on it to serve
cut the dumpling in half wrap it in a
piece of letters together with some
herbs dip it in the sauce and enjoy its
